curlpit

Terminal-first HTTP runner

Compose requests like scripts. Re-run them in style.

curlpit gives you a dedicated shell-native space to craft, replay, and export HTTP requests. No tabs, no clutter—just crisp neon feedback and focused terminal ergonomics.

View on GitHub
Get productive in seconds:
curlpit --preview 200 requests/httpbin-get.curl
curlpit session 
$ crlp examples/httpbin-get.curl --preview 200
> GET https://httpbin.org/get
> Status 200 OK (960 ms)
> Body saved to ~/tmp/curlpit-2025-09-27.json
> Preview
{
  "headers": {
    "Authorization": "Bearer demo-token",
    "Content-Type": "application/json"
  }
}

File-first flow

Keep requests alongside source code with readable .curl files that slot neatly into version control.

Instant previews

Skim JSON responses, headers, and timings without leaving the terminal—colour-coded for signal, not noise.

Template exports

Jump from request to runnable snippets with exporter templates for fetch and beyond.

Profiles & envs

Swap credentials, environments, and variables with one flag. Built for multi-tenant APIs and team workflows.

“curlpit nails the sweet spot between curl scripts and heavyweight API clients. It feels like a trusted shell companion—from neon status cues to instant exports.”
Built for people who live in the terminal. Crafted with ✺ neon vim energy.
